description: Nikola Petrak convenes a late-night meeting with senior Secretariat members. After heated debate, he rejects Directorate intervention—believing communities must be trusted to recover control on their own.

Nikola signs an emergency order suspending central authority and granting districts the right to self-organize essential services. He notifies depot managers and agency heads, instructing them to release supplies directly to local assemblies.

Neighborhood assemblies and newly chosen community leaders begin openly organizing food, medicine, and security. Grassroots networks share advice and coordinate across district lines, while some areas struggle with old rivalries and resource challenges.
Resource hoarding and local power struggles erupt in weaker districts, but volunteer mediators—including several 'vanished' citizens—begin negotiating truces and stabilizing aid distribution.
Several districts unite to announce a citywide federation for mutual aid and transparent governance, calling for public participation in designing Stenograd’s post-BCI system.
